00012 /**
00013  * @brief denotes return point from co-routine call.
00014  */
00015 typedef struct tagCRETURN_POINT
00016 {
00017   ucontext_t context;
00018 } CRETURN_POINT;
00019 
00020 
00021 CRETURN_POINT *CRETURN_POINT_init();

00023 /** 
00024  * @defgroup CTHREAD
00025  * @brief a coroutine thread.
00026  *
00027  * A very limited user mode threading package that allows constructions of co-routines.
00028  * Coroutine scheduling is done by mean of mkcontet/setcontext/getcontext functions (glibc)
00029  *
00030  * User mode threads are best when used in a very limited scenario, complex usage scenarios often
00031  * lead to intricate situations that are hard to debug.
00032  * Areas where user mode threading shines 
00033  *   - coroutines / continuations
00034  *   - generator funcions (like python/ruby/perl).
00035  *
00036  *
00037  * @{
00038  */
00039 typedef enum {
00040   CTHREAD_STATE_INIT,
00041   CTHREAD_STATE_RUNNING,
00042   CTHREAD_STATE_SUSPENDED,
00043   CTHREAD_STATE_EXIT,
00044 } CTHREAD_STATE;
00045 
00046 
00047 
00048 typedef struct tagCTHREAD {
00049   ucontext_t context_coroutine;
00050   ucontext_t context_caller;
00051   CTHREAD_STATE state;
00052   uint32_t thread_id;
00053   void *ctx;
00054   void *rvalue;
00055   CTHREAD_PROC proc;  
00056   struct tagCTHREAD *prev_thread;
00057   STACK_ENTRY *stack_entry;  
00058 } CTHREAD;
00059 
00060 
00061 
00062 int CTHREAD_libinit();
00063 
00064 /**
00065  * @brief initialises a new co-routine thread. 
00066  
00067  * Postcondition: The new thread is in CTHREAD_STATE_INIT state.
00068 
00069  * @param stacks the thread is obtained from the pool of stacks (argument stack).
00070  * @param proc The thread procecdure is argument proc.
00071  * @param ctx argument passed to thread procedure.
00072  */
00073 CTHREAD * CTHREAD_init( STACKS *stacks, CTHREAD_PROC proc, void *ctx );
00074 
00075 /**
00076  * @brief start a new thread - the thread procedure is invoked.
00077  *
00078  * Precondition: the thread is in either CTHREAD_STATE_INIT or CTHREAD_STATE_EXIT state.
00079  * Postcondition: the thread is in CTHREAD_STATE_RUNNING state.
00080  *
00081  * The function returns if the running thread either exited or entered suspended state (i.e. the thread called yield)
00082  */
00083 int CTHREAD_start( CTHREAD *thread );
00084 
00085 /**
00086  * @brief waits till the thread has finished 
00087  * Callss CTHREAD_resume repeatedly unntil the thread finishes.
00088  */
00089 int CTHREAD_join( CTHREAD *thread );
00090 
00091 /**
00092  * deallocates a thread 
00093  *
00094  * Precondition: the thread must be in CTHREAD_STATE_EXIT state 
00095  */ 
00096 int CTHREAD_free( CTHREAD *thread );
00097 
00098 /**
00099  * @brief start a new thread - the thread procedure is invoked.
00100  *
00101  * Precondition: the thread is in either CTHREAD_STATE_INIT or CTHREAD_STATE_EXIT state.
00102  * Postcondition: the thread is in CTHREAD_STATE_RUNNING state.
00103  *
00104  * The function returns to the context defined in CRETURN_POINT *next argument. the function returns to this spot 
00105  * if the thread exited or entered suspended state.
00106  */
00107 int CTHREAD_start_ex( CTHREAD *thread, CRETURN_POINT *next );
00108 
00109 /**
00110  * @brief a running thread temporarily suspends execution
00111  *
00112  * Precondition: the thread is in CTHREAD_STATE_RUNNING state
00113  * Postcondition: the thread is in CTHREAD_STATE_SUSPENDED state
00114  */
00115 int CTHREAD_yield();
00116 
00117 /**
00118  * @brief resume a suspended thread
00119  *
00120  * Precondition: the thread is in CTHREAD_STATE_SUSPENDED state
00121  * Postcondition: the thread is in CTHREAD_STATE_RUNNING state
00122   */
00123 int CTHREAD_resume( CTHREAD *thread);
00124 
00125 /**
00126  * @brief running thread sets its return value.
00127  *
00128  * Precondition: the thread is in CTHREAD_STATE_RUNNING state
00129  */
00130 int CTHREAD_set_return_value(void *rvalue);
00131 
00132 /**
00133  * @brief get return value of a thread
00134  *
00135  * Precondition: the thread is in CTHREAD_STATE_SUSPENDED or CTHREAD_STATE_EXIT state
00136  */
00137 int CTHREAD_get_return_value(CTHREAD *thread, void **rvalue);
00138 
00139 /**
00140  * @brief get thread id
00141  *
00142  * Precondition: the thread is in any state other than CTHREAD_STATE_INIT
00143  */
00144 uint32_t CTHREAD_get_tid();
00145 
00146 /**
00147  * @brief get thread state
00148  */
00149 M_INLINE CTHREAD_STATE CTHREAD_state(CTHREAD *thread) 
00150 {
00151   return thread->state;
00152 }

00154 /**
00155  * @}
00156  */
00157 
00158 #endif
